main event: Multiple sightings of a bright white object assumed to be ECHO I observed in New York City in May 1964.
interesting points: The object was first observed moving rapidly from south to zenith before remaining stationary and then continuing northward., Observations were made from different locations and times, indicating a widespread interest in the object., The object was described as appearing similar to a star but larger and brighter., Two different eyewitnesses provided detailed descriptions of the object at different times but referred to similar characteristics., The reports included various assumptions about the object's nature, suggesting it could be a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomenon.
sighted object: bright white object, assumed to be ECHO I
location: New York City, New York, USA
witnesses: friends engaged in astronomy, personnel of the Manhattan Construction Company
